intro: Strigilia pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered strigil, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clustered umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and fern-like, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
